meanings.definition: Laicisms: beliefs or practices that are characteristic of lay people rather than clergy
meanings.sent1: The laicisms of the community center focused on inclusivity and volunteerism.
meanings.sent2: She studied the laicisms of different religions for her sociology project.
meanings.sent3: The laicisms of the book club included heated debates over fictional characters.
meanings.sent4: His artwork reflected the laicisms of everyday life in the city.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the importance of laicisms in modern society.

meanings.definition: Laicisms: the state or condition of being a layperson rather than a member of the clergy
meanings.sent1: The laicisms of the congregation were evident in their active participation during services.
meanings.sent2: She embraced the laicisms of her role as a community volunteer.
meanings.sent3: The laicisms of the bake sale committee led to delicious treats for the fundraiser.
meanings.sent4: His decision to leave the priesthood marked his transition into laicisms.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of her attire reflected her commitment to laicisms.
